Updated details in regards to Skiing, Personal Life and Football based on Jeremy Bloom website, NFL documents, New York Times, Olympedia, and The Associated Press. These changes were made easier and I went in to properly link the sources at the bottom. The information previously shown on this page was out of date
Updated the Skiing Career section based on Skiing History Organization https://www.skiinghistory.org/online-magazine/where-are-they-now-jeremy-bloom
Adding the right birthplace based on https://jeremybloom.com/
Adding additional sources to Personal life

Correcting previously approved changes due to logging in on a computer with past changes. Sources for these changes include Jeremy Bloom's website https://jeremybloom.com/, University of Colorado Football https://cubuffs.com/sports/football/roster/jeremy-bloom/3697, Wishofalifetime Wishofalifetime.org, Olympedia https://www.olympedia.org/athletes/101347. This article hasn't been updated in the past 5 years to account for Bloom's Olympic wins. His personal life section had the wrong home town
U.S Ski and Snowboard Hall of Fame show Bloom's hometown as Loveland Colorado. The source also breaks down Bloom's earlier achievements in sports https://skihall.com/hall-of-famers/jeremy-bloom/

I made changes to the bio using https://news.cuanschutz.edu/news-stories/jeremy-bloom as a resource. Along with the academic journal, I also referenced Jeremy Blooms website https://jeremybloom.com/.  Big Speak Motivational Speakers Bureau is another resource for Jeremy Bloom's nonprofit- information that I added to the bio

"Jeremy Bloom is the only dual-sport athlete to ski in the Olympics and be drafted into the NFL. He is a three-time World Champion, two-time Olympian, eleven-time World Cup gold medalist and a member of the United States Skiing Hall of Fame. He won a record six straight World Cup events, the most in a single season in the sport’s history. He’s also an All-American football player at the University of Colorado and played in the NFL for the Eagles and Steelers." as according to CNBC
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contribs/Jeremybloomfan|Jeremybloomfan]] ([[User talk:Jeremybloomfan|talk]]) to last version by Smalljim

restore (yet again) to the last stable version. We can't use self-published sources for a lot of this kind of claim; some of these sources and material have been rejected previously for various reasons; a lot of sourced content has been removed
